header.title: MOSA License Affilliation
header.abstract: This specification provides a means for MOSA members to allow other MOSA members to use or port, and relicense certain portions of code.

remark.p: Ammended a problem where projects could remove the header and cause legal issues.

section1.p: Bodies within MOSA may wish to license their code in such a way that it may be (one or more of):
In such a way that all of the following conditions are met:

ul.li: The license may be changed to the new project's license of choice
Recognition will be given to all authors
Applicable changes are submitted to the original project

section1.p: A project that wants to share code should add this code header to applicable files. This header MUST be placed below an OSI-approved license header.
section1.code: /* This project is affiliated with MOSA (Managed Operating Systems Alliance). * Please see the mosalicense.txt for information on the license. * * If this file is copied place relevant information at the end of the authors * section below according to the format: * < First Name > < Family Name >: * < Project > - < License Name > * * Authors: */
section1.p: The following file MUST be included in the repository in an obvious location, and MUST not be modified unless this document is ammended.
section1.code:
This project is affiliated with MOSA (Managed Operating Systems Alliance). Other projects within MOSA may code files within this code repository that have the MOSA license header. They are allowed to use the files containing the header in the following ways:
o Port it directly to another programming language, o Use it directly, o Compile against it in a dynamically linked fashion, o Compile against it in a statically linked fashion,
without the former licensing provided that they:
o Only append author, project and licensing information to the header. o Provide feedback and patches to the original project (for any portable changes). o Place the header in their code, below their license agreement. o Place a new OSI-approved license header in the code file. o This license must idemnify all contributors to the code from all liabilities.
This exception is bound to the specific version of the file, that version of that file is known as affiliated. If the header is removed from the affiliated file, the new version of the file becomes known as removed. All projects that use the affiliated file may continue to do so: but are not required to submit updates to the originating project. If the originating project re-adds the header to the removed file and wishes to obtain updates it must inform all the other projects within MOSA of this action.
Destination projects will not be held responsible for not providing updates to a previously removed file if they were not made aware that it became affiliated once again.

section1.p: Futher consideration must be given to the legalities of the process.
